meanings.definition: To grind or gnash the teeth in anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: She would snash her teeth when she was upset.
meanings.sent2: He tends to snash his teeth when he's really mad.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character snashed his teeth loudly in annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The gears of the old machine seemed to snash together angrily.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her teeth snashing echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp sound, often made by grinding teeth.
meanings.sent1: The snash of teeth could be heard across the room.
meanings.sent2: The sudden snash startled everyone in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The snash of the door closing made her jump.
meanings.sent4: The snash of metal against metal rang out in the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The snash of the chalk on the blackboard made her cringe.

meanings.definition: To speak or act in a violent or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to snash his words when he's angry.
meanings.sent2: She would often snash at others when she felt threatened.
meanings.sent3: The toddler snashed his toys around the room in a tantrum.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside seemed to snash against the windows.
meanings.sent5: The angry driver would snash his horn impatiently in traffic.
